content.content: Hi all - Duncan from Boardroom here  Part of Boardroom’s mission is to increase informed participation in governance. As a project supporting Uniswap we thought it would be useful to provide a weekly recap of recent governance activity in the Uniswap community. Unlike the UNI Letter (which stopped shipping in May), this recap will focus exclusively on governance, similar to our coverage of Optimism governance. We believe this will be useful for delegates and voters due to the sometimes rapid pace of governance news and updates. When appropriate we’ll also note a few specific areas for action on timely subjects. Within our weekly recap, we’ll provide a look back at:  Proposals Governance changes Impactful operating suggestions, and Critical governance-related discussions across Discourse, Twitter, and Discord  The first recap will be posted today. We’d love to hear your feedback and any suggestions you might have. Feel free to DM to set up a time to chat!
content.GPT-summary: The author of the post, Duncan from Boardroom, is explaining their mission to increase informed participation in governance and announcing a weekly recap of recent governance activity in the Uniswap community. They are asking for feedback and suggestions from the readers.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: Week of September 26, 2022  Summary It’s been a relatively quiet week here on the forums, even while Uniswap Labs has been traveling the world to attend conferences. See below to find out about all that’s percolating.  Proposals Proposal discussions:   Fund Uniswap DAO community operations through loans on Fringe Finance. This proposal offers the DAO the opportunity to open a line of credit with Fringe and receive up to ~$49m in USDC, which can be used at the DAO’s discretion. This would be possible since UNI is already a collateral asset on Fringe, which has set the loan-to-value at 49%. The (floating) interest rate is currently 7.62% per year.  Temperature checks:  None active this week  Consensus checks:   Deploy Uniswap V3 to zkSync, proposed by FranklinDAO, passed with nearly 100% voting “yes.” See the forum discussion here.  On-chain votes:  None active this week   In the Forums Delegate pitches: check out this forum category to learn more about delegates @mhonkasalo and @teemulau, FranklinDAO (previously @pennblockchain), Gauntlet, and Gamma Strategies, among others.  In Discord Do protocols need permission from Uniswap governance to build “on top of” Uniswap?  Check-in on the governance channel to see what’s being discussed.  On Twitter Read the new FAQ about Uniswap v3’s Business Source License — critical to governance. How Uniswap V3 keeps track of fee calculations “under the hood.” Twitter Space: Uniswap Labs x Just-In-Time Liquidity Research Check out the first wave of grants awarded by the Uniswap Foundation.  Follow the Uniswap Governance Bot for instant updates on on- and off-chain proposals.  Community Calls  The next call is on October 5 (8PM GMT). See the calendar on Boardroom for all Uniswap related events, including proposal start and end dates. Quick Gov Links: Governance explainer | Uniswap forums | Snapshot | On-chain proposals | Twitter governance bot | Discord governance channel | Uniswap on Boardroom
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is asking for feedback

content.content: Absolutely love this write up, thanks team!

Week of October 3, 2022  Summary We have one active, on-chain vote (see below), and several interesting discussions taking place. Of note: A while back Uniswap protocol received $1m in $OP from the Optimism Foundation “to incentivize future growth within the Optimism ecosystem,” as @devinwalsh writes.  See Devin’s post and provide feedback on how the liquidity mining portion of the grant (80%) should be structured.  Proposals Proposal discussions:   Fund Uniswap DAO community operations through loans on Fringe Finance. This discussion continues from last week (see summary above).  Here’s a request to “add Ethereum Fair and Ethereum POW to the UI.”  Temperature checks:  None active this week  Consensus checks:  None active this week  On-chain votes:   Deploy Uniswap V3 on zkSync (2.25). Franklin DAO is partnering with Matter Labs to put forward this proposal to deploy Uniswap V3 on zkSync “to support Uniswap’s multichain mission and expand cross-chain experiences.”   Voting for the above proposal ends on October 14.  In the Forums Three interesting questions for the community from @UniSwapVibes.  In Discord Here’s to trying to get a better understanding of Uniswap governance. Check out the Question of the Day.  Check-in on the governance channel to see what’s being discussed.  On Twitter “In DeFi we want to remove these inequalities and barriers to entry to create fairer markets for everyone,” says @Uniswap Labs. The history and evolution of Uniswap V3. New Uniswap Content Manager! @frogmonkee. Two hackathons in Bogatá sponsored by the Uniswap Foundation. License exemption to deploy Uniswap v3 to Aurora? A question for governance, discussed during the community call. Talent partner: Uniswap Labs will be a @BanklessHQ talent partner for Q4.  Community Calls Community calls are held every other Wednesday at 8PM GMT, in Discord. The next one is on October 19.  Check out all the other events happening in Uniswap Discord. There were several this past week, and there are several coming up. Quick Gov Links: Working Constitution | Operating Manual v0.2 | Proposal template | Delegates | Snapshot | Optimism on Boardroom

content.content: Week of October 10, 2022  Summary There were some major updates from the Uniswap Foundation this week, including the announcement of a $165m Series B raise and a refreshed web app (and Help Center). Hurray! The proposal to deploy Uniswap V3 on zkSync passed, and we’ve got consensus on paths forward for the Optimism-Uniswap liquidity mining program.  Proposals Snapshot votes:   Optimism-Uniswap Protocol LM Program: Pool selection.This Snapshot poll ended this morning with 96% voting for the WETH/USDC & WETH/DAI pools.  Optimism-Uniswap Protocol LM Program: Structure. This Snapshot poll ended with 96% voting for a three-phase deployment. (Note the recent clarifying post from @devinwalsh.)  On-chain votes:   Deploy Uniswap V3 on zkSync (2.25). This proposal succeeded with nearly 100% voting “for” and has been executed.   In the Forums Fee switch thoughts: @logart123 thinks “we need to align the interests of UNI hodlers and LP’s and at the same time increase demand for the token,” and shares their ideas about how. Delegate platform update, from FranklinDAO (@pennblockchain).  In Discord A reminder to delegate your UNI, to yourself or others, if you want to participate in governance.  What’s the question of the day?  On Twitter Check out all the Uniswap events (hosted in Discord). Uniswap Foundation raises $165m in Series B. Here’s a Twitter space on the refreshed Uniswap web app.  Governance Calls Community calls are held every other Wednesday at 8PM GMT, in Discord. The next one is on October 19, 8PM GMT. Quick Gov Links: Governance explainer | Uniswap forums | Snapshot | On-chain proposals | Twitter governance bot | Discord governance channel | Uniswap on Boardroom

content.content: Week of October 17, 2002  Summary It’s been a pretty quiet week on the governance front — except for that Binance thing.  Proposals   Optimism-Uniswap Protocol LM Program: Pool selection.This Snapshot poll ended last week with 96% voting for the WETH/USDC, WETH/DAI, USDC/DAI pools.  Optimism-Uniswap Protocol LM Program: Structure. This Snapshot poll ended last week with 96% voting for a three-phase deployment.  See the forum discussion for both of these Snapshots.  In the Forums It’s kinda quiet around here.   In Discord  What’s the question of the day?  On Twitter  Take this user research survey, conducted by @GFXlabs, which is creating a pro user interface for Uniswap. Binance delegated 13m UNI to itself when it moved the tokens between wallets, prompting some interesting governance questions. Community Analytics — Bounty #18 winners announced. Developing the Uniswap web app, a Twitter Space.  Calls  Introduction to Uniswap V3 on Friday, October 28 4pm GMT. content.content: Week of October 24, 2022  Summary Happy Halloween!   It’s survey season! Take them all to help form the future: Here’s one about creating a pro user interface, one about the Fee Switch, one about governance participation, and one for testing a DAO proposal feed.  Proposals Nothing active this week.  In the Forums Incentivizing liquidity on Optimism and Arbitrum. @devenmatthews wonders if the old conversation has continued elsewhere. Uniswap pro trading interface. @GFXLabs is still doing user research for this — fill out the survey! More user research: @SamB23 from Alastor asks Uniswap LPs to fill out a survey for a report on the Fee Switch (funded by a Uniswap grant).  In Discord There’s a vote planned for November / December on the three test pools for fee sharing on Uniswap V3. Take the survey to beta-test Holdim, a feed for DAO proposals. And take this survey on governance participation from Harvard/Abra, which is “aimed in the long run to introduce novel ‘hive mind’ mechanisms.” Anon forums. How would they affect the quality of discussion?  On Twitter Uniswap V3 TWAP Oracles in Proof of Stake, a research piece from Uniswap Labs. Optimism-Uniswap liquidity mining: Phase 1 of the recently approved incentive program is live. content.content: Week of November 14, 2022  Summary Check out Alastor’s fee switch report noted below. A vote on the fee switch could be forthcoming in early December.  Proposals Snapshot proposals:   [Temperature Check] Deploy Uniswap V3 to Boba Network. This proposal passed on November 17 with nearly 100% voting “yes.” It was intended to determine community sentiment regarding the idea of deploying Uniswap V3 on Boba Network — as the title indicates. Boba is a multi-chain L2 already deployed on Ethereum, Avalanche, BNB, and Moonbeam, and utilizes something called Hybrid Compute, which allows “developers and creators to leverage off-chain compute and real-world data.”  Proposal Discussion:   pUniswap - A Privacy Layer for Uniswap. @privacymind from the Incognito team proposes “a solution for Uniswap’s privacy and liquidity fragmentation…problems.”   In the Forums Fee switch research: @Stastny from Alastor provides their grant-funded report regarding potential fee switch implementation. Delegate platform update. @teemulau provides the latest on their voting decisions.  On Twitter Doubling DAOn: Why Decentralization Matters. A Twitter Spaces event with the Uniswap Foundation, Gnosis, and Metamask Institutional. Wish List. The Uniswap Foundation’s initial wish list for grants. Here’s a Space on Alastor’s fee switch report (see above). Why DeFi and decentralization matter — Hayden recalls what he said 18 months ago. “DeFi protocols like Uniswap will do for internet finance what email protocols did for internet comms.”  Community Calls  Introduction to Uniswap V3 coming up tomorrow in Discord. November 22, 18:00 UTC. Quick Gov Links: Governance explainer | Uniswap forums | Snapshot | On-chain proposals | Twitter governance bot | Discord governance channel | Uniswap on Boardroom

content.content: Week of November 21, 2022  Summary There’s been increased activity — and some important reflection on Uniswap governance processes.  Proposals [RFC]: Community Governance Process Changes. @devinwalsh from the Uniswap Foundation restarts a conversation about adjusting the Uniswap governance process, primarily to “reduce overhead” and “enhance off-chain signaling.” The main changes are: replace the first Snapshot poll (a temp-check, as below for example) with a request-for-comment (RFC) post in the forum (such as this very one); and increase the quorum to 5M UNI for the remaining Snapshot (the “consensus check”). The intention to formalize a process for future changes to off-chain governance components is also expressed. A Snapshot for this proposal will be posted on December 12.  Leave your comments on the proposed process changes. [Temperature Check]: Deploy Uniswap V3 on Scroll. This proposal to deploy on Scroll, a “native zkEVM Layer 2 solution for Ethereum,” was just posted to the forums this morning. The Snapshot is set to go live on December 1. [Temperature Check]: Fix the Cross Chain Messaging Bridge on Arbitrum. Uniswap deployments on chains other than Ethereum do not have native access on-chain Uniswap governance, meaning that governance decisions must passed along from Ethereum to other chains via a messaging system. With this proposal, @bharat_eth suggests a fix for the currently “mis-configured” method of cross-chain communication with Uniswap’s Arbitrum deployment. [Consensus Check]: Deploy Uniswap V3 to Boba Network. This proposal passed on November 24 with 78% voting in favor. In their considered dissent, @GFXlabs suggest that it might be time “to set up a framework/checklist for future Uniswap v3 deployments” to make sure upsides and downsides are fully taken into account by the community.  In the Forums Delegate platforms. @mhonkasalo updates their voting record, as does FranklinDAO (@pennblockchain).  In Discord Introduce yourself! When and how did you get into web3?  On Twitter Let’s play a game, with Uniswap Labs and @Wordcelllabs. A quick summary of Uniswap governance this past week. Did you know there’s a Uniswap governance bot?  Community Calls  The next Community Call is on Wednesday, November 30, at 21:00 UTC. Quick Gov Links: Governance explainer | Uniswap forums | Snapshot | On-chain proposals | Twitter governance bot | Discord governance channel | Uniswap on Boardroom

Week of November 28, 2022  Summary Several important discussions happening in the Uniswap community this week, including those having to do with the “fee switch” and governance process changes. See more on both below.  Proposals [RFC]. Community Governance Process Changes. This important discussion continues. [Temperature Check]: Deploy Uniswap V3 on Scroll. This proposal passed on December 4 with 74% voting “Yes.” [Consensus Check]: Fix the Cross Chain Messaging Bridge on Arbitrum. This proposal passed on December 3 with 100% voting “Yes.”  In the Forums Fee Switch pilot update. @Leighton and @guil-lambert lay out their proposal, which could go up for a vote within the next two weeks. Delegate platform. FranklinDAO (@pennblockchain) updates their voting record, including rationales. Uniswap Risk DAO. @RevoGames begins discussion on the creation of one.  On Twitter Fee Switch considerations. The Uniswap Foundation tweets about things to consider, with legal and regulatory issues attended to in a Mirror post. Happy birthday beacon chain!  Community Calls  Keep your eye on the events section in Discord for details on the next community call — and lots of other interesting calls that may or may not be related to governance. content.content: Week of December 5, 2022  Summary The proposed community governance process changes are going to be put to a vote on Snapshot on Wednesday, December 14. There is at least one open question that could use more community feedback — take a look at the latest version of the proposal. The important “fee switch” discussion continues, with several new posts since last week. Keep up to date with this thread.  Proposals No proposals active this past week, but keep your eye out for important ones coming up.  In the Forums Uniswap V3 to BNB chain? @ilia_0x makes a case for deployment. Temp-check feedback. @Scroll shares what they learned prior to and during the Snapshot vote on their proposal.  In Discord What role does governance have “if all protocol contracts are non-upgradeable”?  On Twitter The importance of self-custody, in DeFi and NFTs. A few tweets from Uniswap Labs. The Economist. Hayden Adams makes the case for DeFi in the venerable magazine.  Community Calls  Uniswap Community Call coming up in Discord this Wednesday, December 14 (21:00 UTC). content.content: Week of December 12, 2022  Summary Several important discussions and proposals sit before the Uniswap community.  As you consider each, also take some time to read through FranklinDAO’s recently posted (and excellent) “Deep Dive” on Uniswap’s governance. Update on the “fee switch” discussion: After constructive feedback, @Leighton writes about shifting the approach and creating a legal entity before proceeding to a proposal. This will take several weeks. In the meantime, it is good to see that “the simple posting and planning for the vote also generated a high level of engagement from new and existing stakeholders.”  Proposals [On-chain] Fix the Cross Chain Messaging Bridge on Arbitrum. This proposal suggests a fix for the currently “mis-configured” method of cross-chain communication with Uniswap’s Arbitrum deployment. [On-chain] Deploy Uniswap V3 to Boba Network. Boba is a multi-chain L2 already deployed on Ethereum, Avalanche, BNB, and Moonbeam. [Temp-check] Community Governance Process Changes. Vote here on this important proposal if you haven’t already. And see here the explanation by GFX Labs of a slightly different approach that would enable on-chain (instead of off-chain) polling. [RFC] Phase 2 - Optimism-Uniswap Protocol Liquidity Mining Program. The Foundation is seeking input into the second phase, “where 100k $OP will be disbursed over 3 weeks time.”  In the Forums Uniswap v3 on BSC. @GFXlabs post their thoughts on the idea. Delegate platform. FranklinDAO (@pennlockchan) update their voting history. Protocol Guild. @trent provides an update on the “new public goods funding mechanism that was launched with your backing” six months ago.  In Discord You can hold any amount of UNI and vote, even zero (with delegation). Would anonymous proposal feedback be useful in Uniswap?  On Twitter Phase 1 of the Uniswap-Optimism liquidity mining program is “in the books.” Devin Walsh was on the Cross-chain Examination podcast. Quick Gov Links: Governance explainer | Uniswap forums | Snapshot | On-chain proposals | Twitter governance bot | Discord governance channel | Uniswap on Boardroom
